alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Fairfield, Kershaw and Richland. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winnsboro, Longtown, Lake Carolina, Fairfield County Airport, Lugoff, Blythewood, Ridgeway, Smallwood, Winnsboro Mills, Rion, Fairfield County Detention Center, Fairfield Elementary School and Pine Grove Fire Station. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 between mile markers 24 and 42. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
